description: Outlook is Microsoft's email and calendaring platform integrating contacts and scheduling, enabling users to manage communications and events in a unified workspace

tools.name: OUTLOOK_ADD_EVENT_ATTACHMENT
tools.description: Adds an attachment to a specific Outlook calendar event. Use when you need to attach a file or nested item to an existing event.

inputSchema.title: AddEventAttachmentRequest

item.title: Item
item.description: The nested item payload; required when '@odata.type' is itemAttachment.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the attachment.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar event to which the attachment will be added.

contentBytes.title: Content Bytes
contentBytes.description: Base64-encoded file contents; required when '@odata.type' is fileAttachment.

inputSchema.description: Request parameters for adding an attachment to an Outlook calendar event.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_ADD_MAIL_ATTACHMENT
tools.description: Tool to add an attachment to an email message. Use when you have a message ID and need to attach a small (<3 MB) file or reference.

inputSchema.title: AddMailAttachmentRequest

item.title: Item
item.description: Embedded item (e.g., message, event) for itemAttachment; must include its own '@odata.type'.

name.title: Name
name.description: Display name of the attachment (e.g., file name).

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's principal name or 'me' for the authenticated user.

isInline.title: Is Inline
isInline.description: Set to true if the attachment should appear inline in the message body.

contentId.title: Content Id
contentId.description: Content ID for inline attachments, used in HTML body references.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Unique identifier of the email message to attach to.

odata_type.title: Odata Type
odata_type.description: The OData type of the attachment. For file attachments, use '#microsoft.graph.fileAttachment'.

contentBytes.title: Content Bytes
contentBytes.description: Base64-encoded content of the file attachment (max size 3 MB).

contentLocation.title: Content Location
contentLocation.description: URL location or path for reference attachments.

inputSchema.description: Request model to add an attachment to a specific Outlook email message.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CALENDAR_CREATE_EVENT
tools.description: Creates a new Outlook calendar event, ensuring `start_datetime` is chronologically before `end_datetime`.

inputSchema.title: CreateEventRequest

body.title: Body
body.description: The body of the event. This can be in plain text or HTML format, as specified by the 'is_html' field.

is_html.title: Is Html
is_html.description: Specifies whether the 'body' content is HTML. Set to true for HTML content; otherwise, it's treated as plain text.

show_as.title: Show As
show_as.description: The status to show on the calendar for the duration of the event. Valid values are: 'free', 'tentative', 'busy', 'oof' (out of office), 'workingElsewhere', 'unknown'.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: The subject of the calendar event.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The UPN (User Principal Name) or object ID of the user whose calendar the event will be created in. Use 'me' for the currently authenticated user.

location.title: Location
location.description: The physical location of the event.

time_zone.title: Time Zone
time_zone.description: The time zone for the start and end times of the event. Uses Windows time zone names (e.g., 'Pacific Standard Time') or IANA time zone names (e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'). UTC is also a valid input.

categories.title: Categories
categories.description: A list of categories associated with the event. These categories must already exist in the user's mailbox.

end_datetime.title: End Datetime
end_datetime.description: The end date and time of the event in ISO 8601 format. Time zone is specified in 'time_zone'.

items.title: AttendeeInfo

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the attendee.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of attendee. Valid values are 'required', 'optional', and 'resource'.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the attendee.

items.description: Specifies the email, name, and type of an attendee for a calendar event.

attendees_info.title: Attendees Info
attendees_info.description: A list of attendees for the event. Each attendee object requires an 'email'. 'name' and 'type' ('required', 'optional', 'resource') are optional.

start_datetime.title: Start Datetime
start_datetime.description: The start date and time of the event in ISO 8601 format. Time zone is specified in 'time_zone'.

is_online_meeting.title: Is Online Meeting
is_online_meeting.description: Set to true to indicate that the event is an online meeting. This will automatically generate an online meeting link if 'online_meeting_provider' is set (e.g., a Microsoft Teams link).

online_meeting_provider.title: Online Meeting Provider
online_meeting_provider.description: Specifies the online meeting provider. Currently, only 'teamsForBusiness' is supported. If 'is_online_meeting' is true and this is set, a meeting link for the provider will be created.

inputSchema.description: Defines the request schema for creating a new event in an Outlook calendar.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CREATE_ATTACHMENT_UPLOAD_SESSION
tools.description: Tool to create an upload session for large (>3 MB) message attachments. Use when you need to upload attachments in chunks.

inputSchema.title: CreateAttachmentUploadSessionRequest

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User ID or user principal name; use 'me' for the signed-in user.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to attach to.

attachmentItem.title: Attachment Item

size.title: Size
size.description: Size of the attachment in bytes; must be at least 3 MB (3,145,728 bytes).

isInline.title: Is Inline
isInline.description: Whether the attachment is inline in the message body.

contentId.title: Content Id
contentId.description: Content-ID for inline attachments, referenced in HTML body if isInline is true.

attachmentType.title: Attachment Type
attachmentType.description: Type of the attachment; set to 'file' for file uploads.

attachmentItem.description: AttachmentItem object describing the attachment in the upload session.

inputSchema.description: Request parameters for creating an Outlook attachment upload session.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CREATE_CALENDAR
tools.description: Tool to create a new calendar in the signed-in user's mailbox. Use when organizing events into a separate calendar.

inputSchema.title: CreateCalendarRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the new calendar.

color.title: Color
color.description: The theme color to assign to the calendar. Supported values: auto, lightBlue, lightGreen, lightOrange, lightGray, lightYellow, lightTeal, lightPink, lightBrown, lightPurple, lightRed.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The UPN (User Principal Name) or object ID of the user where the calendar will be created. Use 'me' for the signed-in user.

hexColor.title: Hex Color
hexColor.description: An optional hexadecimal color code for the calendar in the format '#RRGGBB'.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new calendar in the user's mailbox.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CREATE_CONTACT
tools.description: Creates a new contact in a Microsoft Outlook user's contacts folder.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Personal notes about the contact. These notes are stored as 'personalNotes' in the Outlook contact details.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Identifier for the user whose contact list will be modified. Use 'me' for the authenticated user, or provide the user's principal name (e.g., 'user@example.com').

birthday.title: Birthday
birthday.description: The contact's birthday in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format. The time component will be set to midnight UTC (e.g., '1990-01-01' becomes '1990-01-01T00:00:00Z' in the API request).

homePhone.title: Home Phone
homePhone.description: The contact's home phone number. If provided, this will be stored in Outlook as a list containing this single number.

categories.title: Categories
categories.description: A list of categories to assign to the contact.

department.title: Department
department.description: The department the contact belongs to within their company.

companyName.title: Company Name
companyName.description: The name of the company the contact is associated with.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: The contact's display name, typically their full name.

businessPhones.title: Business Phones
businessPhones.description: A list of business phone numbers for the contact. Each number should be a string.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name for the contact's email address.

emailAddresses.title: Email Addresses
emailAddresses.description: A list of email addresses for the contact.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CREATE_CONTACT_FOLDER
tools.description: Tool to create a new contact folder in the user's mailbox. Use when needing to organize contacts into custom folders.

inputSchema.title: CreateContactFolderRequest

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's principal name or object ID. Use 'me' for the authenticated user.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: The display name of the new contact folder.

parentFolderId.title: Parent Folder Id
parentFolderId.description: The ID of the parent contact folder. If omitted, created under the default contacts folder.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new contact folder in the user's mailbox.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CREATE_DRAFT
tools.description: Creates an Outlook email draft with subject, body, recipients, and an optional attachment. Supports creating drafts as part of existing conversation threads by specifying a conversationId; attachments require a name, mimetype, and content.

body.title: Body
examples: Let's meet to discuss the project.
body.description: Content of the email draft; use `is_html` to specify if HTML or plain text.

is_html.title: Is Html
is_html.description: Specifies if the `body` is HTML. If `False`, `body` is plain text.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: Subject line for the email draft.

attachment.title: FileUploadable
attachment.description: Optional file to attach. If provided, must include the file's content, name, and mimetype.

cc_recipients.title: Cc Recipients
cc_recipients.description: Optional list of CC (carbon copy) recipient email addresses.

to_recipients.title: To Recipients
to_recipients.description: List of primary 'To' recipient email addresses.

bcc_recipients.title: Bcc Recipients
bcc_recipients.description: Optional list of BCC (blind carbon copy) recipient email addresses.

conversation_id.title: Conversation Id
conversation_id.description: Optional conversation ID to create the draft as part of an existing email conversation thread. If provided, the draft will be part of the specified conversation instead of starting a new one.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CREATE_DRAFT_REPLY
tools.description: Creates a draft reply in the specified user's Outlook mailbox to an existing message (identified by a valid `message_id`), optionally including a `comment` and CC/BCC recipients.

comment.title: Comment
examples: Thank you for your email. I'll review and respond shortly.
comment.description: Plain text comment to include in the body of the reply draft.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's mailbox identifier (email or 'me') for the original message and new draft location.

cc_emails.title: Cc Emails
cc_emails.description: List of email addresses to add as CC recipients to the draft reply.

bcc_emails.title: Bcc Emails
bcc_emails.description: List of email addresses to add as BCC recipients to the draft reply.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Unique ID of the message to reply to, typically obtained from actions like 'List Messages' or 'Get Message'.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CREATE_EMAIL_RULE
tools.description: Create email rule filter with conditions and actions

actions.title: Actions

forwardTo.title: Forward To
forwardTo.description: List of email addresses to forward matching messages to.

markAsRead.title: Mark As Read
markAsRead.description: Whether to mark matching messages as read.

copyToFolder.title: Copy To Folder
copyToFolder.description: Folder ID to copy matching messages to.

moveToFolder.title: Move To Folder
moveToFolder.description: Folder ID to move matching messages to.

assignCategories.title: Assign Categories
assignCategories.description: List of categories to assign to matching messages.

stopProcessingRules.title: Stop Processing Rules
stopProcessingRules.description: If true, stops processing other rules after this rule's actions execute. Useful for priority rules where you want to prevent lower-priority rules from running. Example: High-priority sender rule that moves to VIP folder and stops other filing rules.

actions.description: Actions to take when the rule conditions are met.

sequence.title: Sequence
sequence.description: Order in which the rule is executed (lower numbers execute first).

conditions.title: Conditions

importance.title: Importance
importance.description: Message importance level to match (low, normal, high).

bodyContains.title: Body Contains
bodyContains.description: List of strings that the message body must contain.

fromAddresses.title: From Addresses
fromAddresses.description: List of exact sender email addresses to match (e.g., 'boss@company.com'). For partial/domain matching, use senderContains instead.

hasAttachments.title: Has Attachments
hasAttachments.description: Whether the message must have attachments.

senderContains.title: Sender Contains
senderContains.description: List of strings for partial sender email matching. If sender email contains ANY of these strings, rule triggers. Useful for domain matching (e.g., '@openai.com') or pattern matching (e.g., 'noreply', 'no-reply', 'notifications'). More flexible than fromAddresses which requires exact matches.

subjectContains.title: Subject Contains
subjectContains.description: List of strings that the message subject must contain.

conditions.description: Conditions that must be met for the rule to apply.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: Display name for the email rule.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CREATE_MAIL_FOLDER
tools.description: Tool to create a new mail folder. Use when you need to organize email into a new folder.

inputSchema.title: CreateMailFolderRequest

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Identifier for the user whose mailbox the folder will be created in. Use 'me' for the authenticated user or provide the user's principal name or ID.

isHidden.title: Is Hidden
isHidden.description: Indicates whether the new folder is hidden. Default is false. Once set, this property cannot be updated.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: The display name of the new mail folder.

inputSchema.description: Defines the request schema for creating a new mail folder in the user's mailbox.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_CREATE_MASTER_CATEGORY
tools.description: Tool to create a new category in the user's master category list. Use after selecting a unique display name.

inputSchema.title: CreateMasterCategoryRequest

color.title: Color
color.description: A pre-set color constant for the category. Allowed values: preset0 through preset24.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: Unique name that identifies the category in the user's mailbox.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new Outlook master category in the user's mailbox.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_DELETE_CONTACT
tools.description: Permanently deletes an existing contact, using its `contact_id` (obtainable via 'List User Contacts' or 'Get Contact'), from the Outlook contacts of the user specified by `user_id`.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The UPN (User Principal Name) or ID of the user; use 'me' for the signed-in user.

contact_id.title: Contact Id
contact_id.description: Identifier of the contact to be deleted, typically obtained from 'List User Contacts' or 'Get Contact'.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_DELETE_EMAIL_RULE
tools.description: Delete an email rule

ruleId.title: Rule Id
ruleId.description: ID of the email rule to delete.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_DELETE_EVENT
tools.description: Deletes an existing calendar event, identified by its unique `event_id`, from a specified user's Microsoft Outlook calendar, with an option to send cancellation notifications to attendees.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the current user.

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: Unique identifier of the calendar event to delete, typically obtained from event listing or retrieval actions.

send_notifications.title: Send Notifications
send_notifications.description: If `True`, sends cancellation notifications to event attendees upon deletion.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_DELETE_MAIL_FOLDER
tools.description: Delete a mail folder from the user's mailbox. Use when you need to remove an existing mail folder.

inputSchema.title: DeleteMailFolderRequest

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Identifier for the user whose mailbox contains the folder to delete. Use 'me' for the authenticated user or provide the user's principal name or ID.

folder_id.title: Folder Id
folder_id.description: The unique identifier or well-known name of the mail folder to delete (e.g., folder ID or 'Drafts', 'SentItems').

inputSchema.description: Defines the request schema for deleting a mail folder from the user's mailbox.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_DOWNLOAD_OUTLOOK_ATTACHMENT
tools.description: Downloads a specific file attachment from an email message in a Microsoft Outlook mailbox; the attachment must contain 'contentBytes' (binary data) and not be a link or embedded item.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's UPN (User Principal Name) or 'me' for the authenticated user. This identifies the mailbox where the message is located.

file_name.title: File Name
file_name.description: The desired filename for the downloaded attachment. This name will be assigned to the `FileDownloadable` object.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The unique identifier of the email message that contains the attachment to be downloaded. This ID is typically obtained when listing or retrieving messages.

attachment_id.title: Attachment Id
attachment_id.description: The unique identifier of the attachment to be downloaded. This ID is typically obtained from the message's details when an email message object is retrieved.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_CALENDAR_VIEW
tools.description: Get events ACTIVE during a time window (includes multi-day events). Use for "what's on my calendar today/this week" or availability checks. Returns events overlapping the time range. For keyword search or filters by category, use OUTLOOK_LIST_EVENTS instead.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of events to retrieve. Default is 100.

select.title: Select
select.description: List of specific event properties to return (e.g., ['subject', 'start', 'end']). If omitted, returns default properties.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Email address of the target user (or 'me' for authenticated user).

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: IANA or Windows timezone for event times (e.g., 'America/New_York'). Defaults to UTC.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Optional ID of a specific calendar to query. If not provided, uses the primary calendar. Get calendar IDs using LIST_CALENDARS action.

end_datetime.title: End Datetime
end_datetime.description: End of the time window in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ). Events active during this window will be returned.

start_datetime.title: Start Datetime
start_datetime.description: Start of the time window in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ). Events active during this window will be returned.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_CONTACT
tools.description: Retrieves a specific Outlook contact by its `contact_id` from the contacts of a specified `user_id` (defaults to 'me' for the authenticated user).

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's principal name (e.g., 'AdeleV@contoso.onmicrosoft.com') or 'me' for the authenticated user. Using 'me' is recommended for accessing one's own contacts.

contact_id.title: Contact Id
contact_id.description: Unique identifier for the contact within the specified user's Outlook address book.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_CONTACT_FOLDERS
tools.description: Tool to retrieve a list of contact folders in the signed-in user's mailbox. Use after authentication when you need to browse or select among contact folders.

inputSchema.title: GetContactFoldersRequest

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of contact folders to return.

skip.title: Skip
skip.description: Number of contact folders to skip for pagination.

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: Related entities to expand inline, e.g., ['contacts'].

select.title: Select
select.description: List of properties to include in the response, e.g., ['id','displayName'].

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: List of properties to order results by, e.g., ['displayName asc'].

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User principal name or ID. Use 'me' for the authenticated user.

inputSchema.description: Request parameters for retrieving contact folders in a user's mailbox.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_EVENT
tools.description: Retrieves the full details of a specific calendar event by its ID from a user's Outlook calendar, provided the event exists.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's primary SMTP address, user principal name (UPN), or the alias 'me' (for the signed-in user) to identify the calendar owner.

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar event to retrieve.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_MAILBOX_SETTINGS
tools.description: Tool to retrieve mailbox settings. Use when you need to view settings such as automatic replies, time zone, and working hours for the signed-in or specified user.

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: OData $expand query to include related entities.

select.title: Select
select.description: OData $select query to specify mailbox settings properties to include.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's unique identifier or principal name. Use 'me' for the signed-in user.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_MAIL_DELTA
tools.description: Retrieve incremental changes (delta) of messages in a mailbox. FIRST RUN: Returns ALL messages in folder (use top=50 to limit). Response has @odata.deltaLink. SUBSEQUENT: Pass stored deltaLink to get only NEW/UPDATED/DELETED messages since last sync. Properties available: id, subject, from, receivedDateTime, isRead, etc. NOT available: internetMessageHeaders, full body, attachment content (response size limits).

inputSchema.title: GetMailDeltaRequest

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of items to return per page. For first run without delta_token, use top=50 or top=100 to limit results. First delta call without token returns all messages in folder. Paginate through results using @odata.nextLink, then store @odata.deltaLink for next sync.

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: List of related entities to expand (e.g. ['attachments']).

select.title: Select
select.description: List of message properties to include (e.g. ['subject','receivedDateTime']). Delta sync has property limitations due to response size constraints. Not available in delta: internetMessageHeaders, body (full), attachments (full content). Available: id, subject, from, toRecipients, ccRecipients, bccRecipients, receivedDateTime, sentDateTime, isRead, isDraft, importance, hasAttachments, categories, conversationId, flag, webLink, bodyPreview (first 255 chars).

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User identifier: 'me' for the signed-in user or the user's email/UPN.

folder_id.title: Folder Id
folder_id.description: Mail folder identifier to scope the delta query to that folder (e.g., 'Inbox' or folder ID GUID). Defaults to Inbox when omitted.

skip_token.title: Skip Token
skip_token.description: Skip token for paging through large result sets during initial sync. Automatically provided in response '@odata.nextLink' when there are more results. Extract from nextLink URL and pass here for next page. Keep paginating until you receive '@odata.deltaLink' instead of nextLink.

delta_token.title: Delta Token
delta_token.description: Delta token from a previous call to get only changes since that state. If delta_token is not provided, the API returns all messages in the folder (initial sync). Use top parameter (e.g., top=50) on first run to limit results. Response includes @odata.deltaLink - extract and store this for next call to get only new changes. Subsequent calls with deltaLink return only: new messages, updated messages, deleted message IDs.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving incremental changes (delta) of messages in a mailbox.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_MAIL_TIPS
tools.description: Tool to retrieve mail tips such as automatic replies and mailbox full status. Use when you need to check recipient status before sending mail.

inputSchema.title: GetMailTipsRequest

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User principal name (UPN) or 'me' for the signed-in user.

EmailAddresses.title: Email Addresses
EmailAddresses.description: Collection of SMTP addresses of recipients to get MailTips for.

MailTipsOptions.title: Mail Tips Options
MailTipsOptions.description: List of mail tip types to retrieve for each recipient.

inputSchema.description: Request model to retrieve MailTips for specified recipients.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_MASTER_CATEGORIES
tools.description: Tool to retrieve the user's master category list. Use when you need to get all categories defined for the user.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of master categories to return (OData $top).

skip.title: Skip
skip.description: Number of master categories to skip for pagination (OData $skip).

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData $filter query to filter master categories.

select.title: Select
select.description: OData $select query to specify properties to include.

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: OData $orderby query to order master categories by property values.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's unique identifier or principal name. Use 'me' for the signed-in user.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_MESSAGE
tools.description: Retrieves a specific email message by its ID from the specified user's Outlook mailbox. Use the 'select' parameter to include specific fields like 'internetMessageHeaders' for filtering automated emails.

select.title: Select
select.description: List of message properties to include in the response. Each item is a property name. MUST be provided as a list. Reduces data transfer and improves performance. Common fields: id, subject, from, toRecipients, ccRecipients, receivedDateTime, sentDateTime, body, bodyPreview, hasAttachments, webLink, internetMessageHeaders, isRead, importance, categories. Leave empty to return all fields.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address, UPN, or 'me' for the currently authenticated user.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Unique ID of the Outlook email message to retrieve.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_PROFILE
tools.description: Retrieves the Microsoft Outlook profile for a specified user.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's unique identifier or principal name. Use 'me' to get the profile of the authenticated user.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_SCHEDULE
tools.description: Retrieves free/busy schedule information for specified email addresses within a defined time window.

inputSchema.title: GetScheduleRequest

EndTime.title: End Time

dateTime.title: Date Time
dateTime.description: A single point in time, expressed in a combined date and time format (ISO 8601). Example: '2023-10-26T10:00:00'.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: The time zone for the 'dateTime'. Uses standard time zone names. Example: 'Pacific Standard Time'.

EndTime.description: The end date, time, and time zone for the period for which to retrieve schedules. The period can be up to 62 days.

Schedules.title: Schedules
Schedules.description: A list of SMTP email addresses for users, distribution lists, or resources whose schedules are to be retrieved. Maximum of 20 addresses.

StartTime.title: Start Time

dateTime.title: Date Time
dateTime.description: A single point in time, expressed in a combined date and time format (ISO 8601). Example: '2023-10-26T10:00:00'.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: The time zone for the 'dateTime'. Uses standard time zone names. Example: 'Pacific Standard Time'.

StartTime.description: The start date, time, and time zone for the period for which to retrieve schedules.

availabilityViewInterval.title: Availability View Interval
availabilityViewInterval.description: The duration of each time slot in the availability view, specified in minutes. Minimum: 5, Maximum: 1440. Default: 30.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving free/busy schedule information.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES
tools.description: Tool to retrieve supported languages in the user's mailbox. Use when you need to display or select from available mailbox languages.

inputSchema.title: GetSupportedLanguagesRequest

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's unique identifier or principal name. Use 'me' for the signed-in user.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving supported mailbox languages.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_GET_SUPPORTED_TIME_ZONES
tools.description: Tool to retrieve supported time zones in the user's mailbox. Use when you need a list of time zones to display or choose from for event scheduling.

inputSchema.title: GetSupportedTimeZonesRequest

timeZoneStandard.title: Time Zone Standard
timeZoneStandard.description: Specifies the time zone format to return. Supported values: 'Windows' or 'Iana'. Default is 'Windows' if not specified.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving supported time zones.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_CALENDARS
tools.description: Tool to list calendars in the signed-in user's mailbox. Use when you need to retrieve calendars with optional OData queries.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of calendars to return (OData $top).

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User ID or userPrincipalName. Use 'me' for the signed-in user.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_CONTACTS
tools.description: Retrieves a user's Microsoft Outlook contacts, from the default or a specified contact folder.

inputSchema.title: ListOutlookContactsRequest

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData V4 filter expression for targeted retrieval.

select.title: Select
select.description: List of specific contact properties to retrieve. Each item is a property name. MUST be provided as a list. If empty, a default set of properties is returned.

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: List of properties to sort results by. Each item is a string like 'displayName asc' or 'createdDateTime desc'. MUST be provided as a list, even for single sort criteria. 'asc' is default.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User Principal Name (UPN) or ID of the user. 'me' refers to the authenticated user.

contact_folder_id.title: Contact Folder Id
contact_folder_id.description: ID of a specific contact folder. If omitted, contacts are retrieved from the default contact folder.

inputSchema.description: Defines the request parameters for listing Outlook contacts.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_EMAIL_RULES
tools.description: List all email rules from inbox

top.title: Top
top.description: Number of rules to retrieve. Default is 100.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_EVENT_ATTACHMENTS
tools.description: Tool to list attachments for a specific Outlook calendar event. Use when you have an event ID and need to view its attachments.

inputSchema.title: GetEventAttachmentRequest

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of attachments to return (OData $top).

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData filter string to filter the attachments (OData $filter).

select.title: Select
select.description: List of attachment properties to include (OData $select).

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: Order by clauses to sort the results (OData $orderby).

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's primary SMTP address, UPN, or 'me' for the signed-in user.

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar event to retrieve attachments for.

inputSchema.description: Request parameters for retrieving attachments of a specific Outlook calendar event.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_EVENTS
tools.description: Retrieves events from a user's Outlook calendar via Microsoft Graph API. Supports primary/secondary/shared calendars, pagination, filtering, property selection, sorting, and timezone specification. Use calendar_id to access non-primary calendars.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of events to retrieve per page for pagination.

skip.title: Skip
skip.description: Number of initial events to bypass, used for pagination.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData query string to filter events (e.g., "start/dateTime ge 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ'"); string literals use single quotes.

select.title: Select
select.description: List of specific event property names to return. Each item is a property name like 'subject' or 'start'. MUST be provided as a list. If omitted, a default set of properties is returned.

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: List of properties to sort results by. Each item is a string like 'start/dateTime desc' or 'subject asc'. MUST be provided as a list, even for single sort criteria. Use 'asc' (default) or 'desc' for order.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Email address of the target user (or 'me' for authenticated user), identifying the calendar for event listing.

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: Preferred IANA or Windows timezone for event start/end times (e.g., 'America/New_York'); defaults to UTC if unspecified/invalid.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Optional ID of a specific calendar to retrieve events from.If not provided, uses the primary calendar. Get calendar IDs using LIST_CALENDARS action. Useful for accessing secondary calendars, shared calendars, or team calendars.

expand_recurring_events.title: Expand Recurring Events
expand_recurring_events.description: When true, automatically expands recurring events to show actual occurrences within the filtered date range instead of series masters. When false (default), returns series masters as before.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_MAIL_FOLDERS
tools.description: Tool to list a user's top-level mail folders. Use when you need folders like Inbox, Drafts, Sent Items; set include_hidden_folders=True to include hidden folders.

inputSchema.title: ListMailFoldersRequest

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's id, userPrincipalName, or 'me' for the signed-in user.

include_hidden_folders.title: Include Hidden Folders
include_hidden_folders.description: Include hidden mail folders (isHidden=true) when set to true.

inputSchema.description: Request parameters for listing mail folders in a user's mailbox.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_MESSAGES
tools.description: Retrieves a list of email messages from a specified mail folder in an Outlook mailbox, with options for filtering (including by conversationId to get all messages in a thread), pagination, and sorting; ensure 'user_id' and 'folder' are valid, and all date/time strings are in ISO 8601 format.

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of messages to return per request (1-1000). Always check response['@odata.nextLink'] for pagination. If present, make additional requests with that URL (includes $skiptoken). Repeat until '@odata.nextLink' is absent. For large mailboxes (1000+ messages), always paginate.

skip.title: Skip
skip.description: Number of messages to skip from the beginning of the result set, for pagination.

folder.title: Folder
folder.description: ID or well-known name of the mail folder. Well-known names: inbox, sentitems, drafts, deleteditems, outbox, junkemail. Or use a valid folder ID.

select.title: Select
select.description: List of message properties to include. Valid properties: id, subject, from, toRecipients, ccRecipients, bccRecipients, receivedDateTime, sentDateTime, hasAttachments, importance, isRead, body, bodyPreview, categories, conversationId, conversationIndex, flag, internetMessageHeaders, parentFolderId, replyTo, sender, webLink, isDraft, isReadReceiptRequested, isDeliveryReceiptRequested, changeKey, createdDateTime, lastModifiedDateTime, inferenceClassification, size, internetMessageId. Note: attachments is not selectable.

is_read.title: Is Read
is_read.description: Filter by read status: 'true' for read, 'false' for unread. Unspecified means no filter by read status.

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: List of properties to sort results by, with direction. Each item is a string like 'receivedDateTime desc' or 'subject asc'. Default is 'receivedDateTime desc'. Cannot be used with sentDateTime filters in Sent folder.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: Filter by exact match of the subject line. Special characters like apostrophes, brackets will be automatically escaped. For complex subject searches, consider using 'Search Messages' instead.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Target user's email or 'me' for authenticated user. For delegated access, use shared mailbox or delegated user's email.

categories.title: Categories
categories.description: Filter by categories (case-sensitive); matches if tagged with any specified category.

from_address.title: From Address
from_address.description: Filter by the sender's exact email address. NOTE: This filter is applied client-side on the returned results, not server-side.

conversationId.title: Conversation Id
conversationId.description: Filter messages by conversation ID to retrieve all messages in a specific email thread.

has_attachments.title: Has Attachments
has_attachments.description: Filter by attachment presence: 'true' for messages with attachments, 'false' for those without. NOTE: This filter is applied client-side on the returned results.

subject_contains.title: Subject Contains
subject_contains.description: Filter messages where the subject contains the specified case-insensitive substring. NOTE: This filter is applied client-side on the returned results. For better performance, use 'Search Messages' instead.

subject_endswith.title: Subject Endswith
subject_endswith.description: Filter messages where the subject ends with the specified case-insensitive string. NOTE: This filter is applied client-side on the returned results. For better performance, use 'Search Messages' instead.

sent_date_time_gt.title: Sent Date Time Gt
sent_date_time_gt.description: Filter messages sent after this ISO 8601 timestamp.

sent_date_time_lt.title: Sent Date Time Lt
sent_date_time_lt.description: Filter messages sent before this ISO 8601 timestamp.

subject_startswith.title: Subject Startswith
subject_startswith.description: Filter messages where the subject starts with the specified case-insensitive string.

received_date_time_ge.title: Received Date Time Ge
received_date_time_ge.description: Filter messages received on or after this ISO 8601 timestamp.

received_date_time_gt.title: Received Date Time Gt
received_date_time_gt.description: Filter messages received after this ISO 8601 timestamp (e.g., '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z').

received_date_time_le.title: Received Date Time Le
received_date_time_le.description: Filter messages received on or before this ISO 8601 timestamp.

received_date_time_lt.title: Received Date Time Lt
received_date_time_lt.description: Filter messages received before this ISO 8601 timestamp.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_OUTLOOK_ATTACHMENTS
tools.description: Lists metadata (like name, size, and type, but not `contentBytes`) for all attachments of a specified Outlook email message.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user. Use the user's UPN (e.g., 'AdeleV@contoso.onmicrosoft.com') or 'me' for the currently authenticated user. This specifies the mailbox to query.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The unique identifier of the email message from which to retrieve attachments. This ID is specific to the Outlook message.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_REMINDERS
tools.description: Tool to retrieve reminders for events occurring within a specified time range. Use when you need to see upcoming reminders between two datetimes.

inputSchema.title: ListRemindersRequest

userId.title: User Id
userId.description: User Principal Name or ID. Use 'me' to indicate the signed-in user.

endDateTime.title: End Date Time
endDateTime.description: The end date and time in ISO 8601 format defining the window for reminders. Example: '2023-10-26T20:00:00.0000000'.

startDateTime.title: Start Date Time
startDateTime.description: The start date and time in ISO 8601 format defining the window for reminders. Example: '2023-10-26T19:00:00.0000000'.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving event reminders within a time window.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_LIST_USERS
tools.description: Tool to list users in Microsoft Entra ID. Use when you need to retrieve a paginated list of users, optionally filtering or selecting specific properties.

inputSchema.title: ListUsersRequest

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of users to return (OData $top). Default page size is 100, maximum is 999.

skip.title: Skip
skip.description: Number of users to skip (OData $skip) for pagination.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: OData filter expression to restrict returned users (OData $filter).

select.title: Select
select.description: List of user properties to include in the response (OData $select).

inputSchema.description: Request schema for listing users in Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD).

tools.name: OUTLOOK_MOVE_MESSAGE
tools.description: Move a message to another folder within the specified user's mailbox. This creates a new copy of the message in the destination folder and removes the original message.

inputSchema.title: MoveMessageRequest

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address, UPN, or 'me' for the currently authenticated user.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Unique ID of the Outlook email message to move.

destination_id.title: Destination Id
destination_id.description: The destination folder ID, or a well-known folder name (e.g., 'inbox', 'deleteditems', 'drafts', 'sentitems').

inputSchema.description: Request parameters for moving a message to another folder.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_QUERY_EMAILS
tools.description: Primary tool for querying Outlook emails with custom OData filters. Build precise server-side filters for dates, read status, importance, subjects, attachments, and conversations. Best for structured queries on message metadata. Returns up to 100 messages per request with pagination support. • Server-side filters: dates, importance, isRead, hasAttachments, subjects, conversationId • CRITICAL: Always check response['@odata.nextLink'] for pagination • Limitations: Recipient/sender/category filters require OUTLOOK_SEARCH_MESSAGES • For keyword/body search: Use OUTLOOK_SEARCH_MESSAGES (KQL syntax)

top.title: Top
top.description: Maximum number of messages to return per request (1-1000). Default is 100. IMPORTANT: For large mailboxes, always check response['@odata.nextLink'] to fetch remaining messages. Pagination example: 1) Call with top=100, 2) Check if '@odata.nextLink' exists in response, 3) If present, make a new request to that full URL (includes $skiptoken), 4) Repeat until '@odata.nextLink' is absent.

skip.title: Skip
skip.description: Number of messages to skip for pagination. NOTE: For large result sets, prefer using '@odata.nextLink' from responses instead of manual skip.

filter.title: Filter
examples: isRead eq false and receivedDateTime ge 2025-10-01T00:00:00Z
importance eq 'high' and hasAttachments eq true
isDraft eq false and isRead eq false and importance eq 'high'
(isRead eq false or importance eq 'high') and receivedDateTime ge 2025-10-01T00:00:00Z
(isRead eq false or importance eq 'high') and hasAttachments eq true
filter.description:
OData $filter query string to filter email messages. Syntax: 'field operator value' combined with 'and', 'or', 'not'.

        **Operators:** eq, ne, lt, le, gt, ge, startswith(), endswith(), contains() (limited support), any()

        **Common Fields (Server-Side Filterable):**
        - `isRead` - Boolean: true/false
        - `importance` - String: 'low', 'normal', 'high'
        - `subject` - String (exact match or startswith)
        - `hasAttachments` - Boolean: true/false
        - `receivedDateTime`, `sentDateTime` - DateTime (ISO 8601: '2025-10-01T00:00:00Z')
        - `conversationId` - String (exact match)
        - `categories` - Array (use any() operator)
        - `toRecipients`, `ccRecipients`, `bccRecipients` - Arrays of recipients (use any())
        - `isDraft`, `isRead`, `flag/flagStatus` - Boolean/String flags

        **Collection Filtering (LIMITED SUPPORT):**
        - ⚠️ Recipients (toRecipients, ccRecipients): NOT supported without advanced query headers

        **Date Filtering:**
        - Dates MUST be in ISO 8601 format with time zone: '2025-10-01T00:00:00Z'
        - Use ge (>=), gt (>), le (<=), lt (<) operators
        - Example: `receivedDateTime ge 2025-10-01T00:00:00Z and receivedDateTime lt 2025-10-02T00:00:00Z`

        **String Filtering:**
        - Exact match: `subject eq 'Meeting Notes'`
        - Starts with: `startswith(subject, '[Action Required]')`
        - Escape single quotes by doubling: `subject eq 'Owner''s Manual'`

        **Complex Nested Properties (NOT directly filterable):**
        - `from/emailAddress/address` - Use OUTLOOK_SEARCH_MESSAGES or client-side filtering instead
        - `body/content` - Use OUTLOOK_SEARCH_MESSAGES for body text search

        **Combining Conditions:**
        - AND: `isRead eq false and importance eq 'high'`
        - OR: `importance eq 'high' or importance eq 'low'`
        - NOT: `not (isRead eq true)`
        - Grouping: `(isRead eq false or importance eq 'high') and hasAttachments eq true`

folder.title: Folder
folder.description: ID or well-known name of the mail folder. Well-known names: 'inbox', 'sentitems', 'drafts', 'deleteditems', 'outbox', 'junkemail' (case-insensitive). Or use a valid folder ID.

select.title: Select
select.description: List of message properties to include in the response. Reduces data transfer and improves performance. Common fields: id, subject, from, toRecipients, ccRecipients, receivedDateTime, sentDateTime, hasAttachments, importance, isRead, body, bodyPreview, categories, conversationId, webLink, internetMessageHeaders, isDraft, flag. Leave empty to return all fields.

orderby.title: Orderby
orderby.description: Comma-separated sort keys with direction. Format: 'field asc' or 'field desc'. Common fields: receivedDateTime, sentDateTime, subject, importance, from. NOTE: Ordering may be automatically disabled by Microsoft Graph API when using certain filters (e.g., subject exact match, conversationId) to avoid 'InefficientFilter' errors. In those cases, results will be unsorted.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Target user's email or 'me' for authenticated user. IMPORTANT: 'me' uses the currently connected account. For cross-mailbox access, ensure you have Mail.Read or Mail.ReadWrite permissions on the target mailbox. 403 errors indicate insufficient delegated/application permissions.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_REPLY_EMAIL
tools.description: Sends a plain text reply to an Outlook email message, identified by `message_id`, allowing optional CC and BCC recipients.

comment.title: Comment
examples: Thank you for your email. I'll review and respond shortly.
comment.description: The plain text body of the reply email.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's email address or 'me' to indicate the authenticated user. This specifies the mailbox from which the reply will be sent.

cc_emails.title: Cc Emails
cc_emails.description: List of email addresses for CC recipients.

bcc_emails.title: Bcc Emails
bcc_emails.description: List of email addresses for BCC recipients.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The unique ID of the message to reply to. This ID can be obtained from the `OUTLOOK_LIST_MESSAGES` action.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_SEARCH_MESSAGES
tools.description: Search Outlook messages using powerful KQL syntax. Supports sender (from:), recipient (to:, cc:), subject, date filters (received:, sent:), attachments, and boolean logic. Only works with Microsoft 365/Enterprise accounts (no @hotmail.com/@outlook.com). Examples: 'from:user@example.com AND received>=2025-10-01', 'to:info@jcdn.nl AND subject:invoice', 'received>today-30 AND hasattachment:yes'

inputSchema.title: SearchMessagesRequest

size.title: Size
size.description: The maximum number of search results to return per page. Use with from_index for pagination.

query.title: Query
query.description:
KQL (Keyword Query Language) search query string. Supports advanced syntax for precise searches.

**Basic Syntax:**
- Simple keywords: 'budget report'
- Exact phrases: '"quarterly review"'
- Boolean operators: 'urgent AND deadline' or 'invoice OR receipt'

**Property Filters (prefix:value):**
- from: Sender email - 'from:user@example.com' or 'from:example.com'
- to: Recipient email - 'to:info@jcdn.nl'
- cc: CC recipient - 'cc:manager@example.com'
- subject: Subject line - 'subject:invoice'
- received: Date received - 'received:2025-10-01' or 'received>=2025-10-01'
- sent: Date sent - 'sent:2025-10-01' or 'sent>=2025-10-01'
- hasattachment: Has files - 'hasattachment:yes' or 'hasattachment:no'

**Date Operators:**
- Exact: 'received:2025-10-01'
- Greater/equal: 'received>=2025-10-01'
- Less/equal: 'received<=2025-10-31'
- Range: 'received:2025-10-01..2025-10-31'
- Relative: 'received>today-7' (last 7 days)

**Combining Filters:**
- AND: 'from:user@example.com AND subject:invoice'
- OR: 'to:sales@example.com OR to:support@example.com'
- Complex: 'from:example.com AND (subject:urgent OR subject:important) AND received>=2025-10-01'

Note: Can be empty if using fromEmail, subject, hasAttachments parameters (legacy support).

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: Text to search for within the message subject line. Legacy parameter - prefer using 'subject:text' in the query parameter for more control. Example: Instead of subject='invoice', use query='subject:invoice AND received>=2025-10-01'

fromEmail.title: From Email
fromEmail.description: Filter messages by sender email address or domain. Supports exact email ('user@example.com') or domain matching ('example.com'). Legacy parameter - prefer using 'from:email@example.com' in the query parameter for more flexibility. Note: Only Microsoft 365/Enterprise accounts are supported (no @hotmail.com or @outlook.com).

from_index.title: From Index
from_index.description: The 0-based starting index for pagination. To paginate: check response['value'][0]['hitsContainers'][0]['moreResultsAvailable']. If true, call again with from_index += size (e.g., 0 → 25 → 50). Message ID is in hits[]['hitId'], not hits[]['resource']['id'].

hasAttachments.title: Has Attachments
hasAttachments.description: Filters messages based on the presence of attachments. Legacy parameter - prefer using 'hasattachment:yes' or 'hasattachment:no' in the query parameter.

enable_top_results.title: Enable Top Results
enable_top_results.description: If `true`, sorts results by relevance; otherwise, sorts by date in descending order (newest first).

inputSchema.description: Searches Outlook messages for Microsoft 365/Enterprise accounts using the Microsoft Search API.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_SEND_DRAFT
tools.description: Tool to send an existing draft message. Use after creating a draft when you want to deliver it to recipients immediately. Example: Send a draft message with ID 'AAMkAG…'.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's email address or 'me' to represent the authenticated user.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The unique identifier of the draft message to send.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_SEND_EMAIL
tools.description: Sends an email with subject, body, recipients, and an optional attachment via Microsoft Graph API. Supports comma-separated email addresses in the to_email field for multiple recipients. Attachments require a non-empty file with valid name and mimetype.

body.title: Body
examples: Hello team, please find the attached report.
body.description: The content of the email body, plain text or HTML based on `is_html`.

from.title: From
from.description: Optional From address to set on the message (send as/on behalf). Provide a single email address. Requires appropriate mailbox permissions.

is_html.title: Is Html
is_html.description: Specifies if the email body is HTML; `True` for HTML, `False` for plain text.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: The subject line of the email.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The display name of the primary recipient.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's email address or the alias 'me' to represent the authenticated user.

to_email.title: To Email
to_email.description: The primary recipient's email address(es). You can provide a single email or multiple emails separated by commas. For CC/BCC recipients, use the respective fields.

cc_emails.title: Cc Emails
cc_emails.description: List of email addresses for CC recipients. Each email should be a separate string in the array. Do NOT pass comma-separated values as a single string.

attachment.title: FileUploadable
attachment.description: Optional file to attach. If provided, its name, mimetype, and content must be valid and non-empty.

bcc_emails.title: Bcc Emails
bcc_emails.description: List of email addresses for BCC recipients. Each email should be a separate string in the array. Do NOT pass comma-separated values as a single string.

save_to_sent_items.title: Save To Sent Items
save_to_sent_items.description: Indicates if the email should be saved in 'Sent Items'.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_UPDATE_CALENDAR_EVENT
tools.description: Updates specified fields of an existing Outlook calendar event. Implementation note: To avoid unintentionally clearing properties, the action first fetches the existing event, merges only the provided fields, and then PATCHes the merged updates. Unspecified fields remain unchanged.

body.title: BodyContent

content.title: Content
examples: Let's meet to discuss the updated project details.
content.description: The actual content of the event body, corresponding to the specified contentType.

contentType.title: Content Type
contentType.description: The format of the event body. Must be 'Text' for plain text or 'HTML' for HTML content.

body.description: Event body with content type ('Text' or 'HTML') and the content. If omitted, the existing body remains unchanged.

show_as.title: Show As
show_as.description: Availability status for the event. Valid values: 'free', 'tentative', 'busy', 'oof'. If omitted, the existing status remains unchanged.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: New subject for the event. If provided as an empty string, the subject will be cleared. If omitted, the existing subject remains unchanged.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The identifier of the user whose calendar event is to be updated. Accepts the user's principal name, ID, or 'me' for the currently authenticated user.

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar event to be updated. This ID can be obtained from the OUTLOOK_LIST_EVENTS action.

location.title: Location
location.description: Event location as a dictionary. If provided, replaces the existing primary location. Omit to leave unchanged.

type.title: Type
type.description: The attendee's type. Valid values are 'required' or 'optional'.

emailAddress.title: Email Address

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the attendee.

address.title: Address
address.description: The complete email address of the attendee.

emailAddress.description: The email address and optional name of the attendee.

attendees.title: Attendees
attendees.description: Attendee list for the event. If provided, replaces the existing attendees. If omitted, attendees remain unchanged.

time_zone.title: Time Zone
time_zone.description: Time zone for the provided start_datetime and/or end_datetime (IANA or Windows time zone names). If omitted, the existing event's time zone is used.

categories.title: Categories
categories.description: Category names to associate with the event. If provided (even empty), replaces the existing categories. If omitted, categories remain unchanged.

end_datetime.title: End Datetime
end_datetime.description: New end date and time for the event. Provide together with a time zone, or the current event's time zone will be used. Must be after start_datetime if both are provided. If omitted, the end time remains unchanged.

start_datetime.title: Start Datetime
start_datetime.description: New start date and time for the event. Provide together with a time zone, or the current event's time zone will be used. If omitted, the start time remains unchanged.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_UPDATE_CONTACT
tools.description: Updates an existing Outlook contact, identified by `contact_id` for the specified `user_id`, requiring at least one other field to be modified.

notes.title: Notes
examples: Met at the annual tech conference. Interested in collaboration.
notes.description: Personal notes about the contact (maps to 'personalNotes' in Microsoft Graph API).

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's identifier; 'me' for the signed-in user, or user's principal name/ID.

contact_id.title: Contact Id
contact_id.description: Unique identifier of the contact to update.

name.title: Name
name.description: Display name for the email address.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_UPDATE_EMAIL
tools.description: Updates specified properties of an existing email message; `message_id` must identify a valid message within the specified `user_id`'s mailbox.

body.title: BodyContent

content.title: Content
examples: This is a plain text update.
content.description: The actual email body content, formatted according to the `contentType`. For example, if contentType is 'HTML', this would be HTML markup.

contentType.title: Content Type
contentType.description: Specifies the format of the email body content. Must be either 'Text' (for plain text) or 'HTML' (for HTML markup).

body.description: New body content (Text or HTML). If omitted, the existing message body remains unchanged.

is_read.title: Is Read
is_read.description: Mark message as read (True) or unread (False). If omitted, read status remains unchanged.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: New subject line. If omitted, the existing subject remains unchanged. Provide empty string to clear the subject.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The UPN (User Principal Name) of the user whose mailbox contains the message, or 'me' for the currently authenticated user. This determines whose message is updated.

importance.title: Importance
importance.description: New importance level ('low', 'normal', 'high'). If omitted, importance is set to 'normal'.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The unique identifier of the email message to be updated. This ID is typically obtained from listing messages or creating/sending a message.

name.title: Name
name.description: Optional display name for the recipient (e.g., 'Katherine Hughes').

address.title: Address
address.description: The SMTP email address of the recipient. For example, 'kat.hughes@example.com'.

cc_recipients.title: Cc Recipients
cc_recipients.description: List of CC recipients; replaces all existing CCs. Omitting this field removes all current CC recipients.

name.title: Name
name.description: Optional display name for the recipient (e.g., 'Katherine Hughes').

address.title: Address
address.description: The SMTP email address of the recipient. For example, 'kat.hughes@example.com'.

to_recipients.title: To Recipients
to_recipients.description: List of TO recipients; replaces all existing TOs. Omitting this field removes all current TO recipients.

name.title: Name
name.description: Optional display name for the recipient (e.g., 'Katherine Hughes').

address.title: Address
address.description: The SMTP email address of the recipient. For example, 'kat.hughes@example.com'.

bcc_recipients.title: Bcc Recipients
bcc_recipients.description: List of BCC recipients; replaces all existing BCCs. Omitting this field removes all current BCC recipients.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_UPDATE_EMAIL_RULE
tools.description: Update an existing email rule

ruleId.title: Rule Id
ruleId.description: ID of the email rule to update.

actions.title: MessageRuleActions

forwardTo.title: Forward To
forwardTo.description: List of email addresses to forward matching messages to.

markAsRead.title: Mark As Read
markAsRead.description: Whether to mark matching messages as read.

copyToFolder.title: Copy To Folder
copyToFolder.description: Folder ID to copy matching messages to.

moveToFolder.title: Move To Folder
moveToFolder.description: Folder ID to move matching messages to.

assignCategories.title: Assign Categories
assignCategories.description: List of categories to assign to matching messages.

stopProcessingRules.title: Stop Processing Rules
stopProcessingRules.description: If true, stops processing other rules after this rule's actions execute. Useful for priority rules where you want to prevent lower-priority rules from running. Example: High-priority sender rule that moves to VIP folder and stops other filing rules.

actions.description: Updated actions to take when the rule conditions are met.

sequence.title: Sequence
sequence.description: Updated order in which the rule is executed (lower numbers execute first).

isEnabled.title: Is Enabled
isEnabled.description: Whether the rule should be enabled or disabled.

conditions.title: MessageRulePredicates

importance.title: Importance
importance.description: Message importance level to match (low, normal, high).

bodyContains.title: Body Contains
bodyContains.description: List of strings that the message body must contain.

fromAddresses.title: From Addresses
fromAddresses.description: List of exact sender email addresses to match (e.g., 'boss@company.com'). For partial/domain matching, use senderContains instead.

hasAttachments.title: Has Attachments
hasAttachments.description: Whether the message must have attachments.

senderContains.title: Sender Contains
senderContains.description: List of strings for partial sender email matching. If sender email contains ANY of these strings, rule triggers. Useful for domain matching (e.g., '@openai.com') or pattern matching (e.g., 'noreply', 'no-reply', 'notifications'). More flexible than fromAddresses which requires exact matches.

subjectContains.title: Subject Contains
subjectContains.description: List of strings that the message subject must contain.

conditions.description: Updated conditions that must be met for the rule to apply.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: Updated display name for the email rule.

tools.name: OUTLOOK_UPDATE_MAILBOX_SETTINGS
tools.description: Tool to update mailbox settings for the signed-in user. Use when you need to configure automatic replies, default time zone, language, or working hours. Example: schedule automatic replies for vacation.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: Display name of the locale (e.g., 'English (United States)').

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: Default mailbox time zone (e.g., 'Pacific Standard Time').

workingHours.title: WorkingHours

timeZone.title: Time Zone

name.title: Name
name.description: Time zone name for working hours (e.g., 'Pacific Standard Time').

time.title: Time
time.description: Time of day when the offset starts in HH:mm:ss.

dayOfWeek.title: Day Of Week
dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week for the offset rule.

dayOccurrence.title: Day Occurrence
dayOccurrence.description: Occurrence of the day of week within the month (1-5).

time.title: Time
time.description: Time of day when the offset starts in HH:mm:ss.

dayOfWeek.title: Day Of Week
dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week for the offset rule.

dayOccurrence.title: Day Occurrence
dayOccurrence.description: Occurrence of the day of week within the month (1-5).

timeZone.description: Time zone details for working hours.

daysOfWeek.title: Days Of Week
daysOfWeek.description: Days of the week for working hours.

workingHours.description: Working hours configuration for the user.

status.title: Status
status.description: The automatic replies status. Possible values: 'disabled', 'alwaysEnabled', 'scheduled'.

externalAudience.title: External Audience
externalAudience.description: Audience for external automatic replies. Possible values: 'none', 'contactsOnly', 'all'.

externalReplyMessage.title: External Reply Message
externalReplyMessage.description: Automatic reply message sent to external senders.

internalReplyMessage.title: Internal Reply Message
internalReplyMessage.description: Automatic reply message sent to internal senders.

scheduledEndDateTime.title: DateTimeTimeZone

dateTime.title: Date Time
dateTime.description: Date and time in ISO 8601 format.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: Time zone of the dateTime value.

scheduledEndDateTime.description: End date and time for scheduled automatic replies.

scheduledStartDateTime.title: DateTimeTimeZone

dateTime.title: Date Time
dateTime.description: Date and time in ISO 8601 format.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: Time zone of the dateTime value.

scheduledStartDateTime.description: Start date and time for scheduled automatic replies.
